title: Sculptor's Model
description:
Small fragment of soft limestone relief with a mottled surface. It was used as a sculptor's trial piece and has a very rough outline of a head apparently that of Akhenaten. It is in the extreme Tell el-Amarna style, but the workmanship is exceptionally crude. It was either the work of a beginner, or was discarded shortly after it was begun. The profile which is ordinarily well done betrays an inexperienced hand. The back is unfinished. 
Condition: The remaining portion is in good condition.
credit_line: Gift of the Egypt Exploration Society

museum_location.name: This item is not on view
